aspecttable.name: SPTCO-1960
aspecttable.reference: This directory contains signaling definitions corresponding to the 1960 Southern Pacific Transportation Company rules as described in the "Rules and Regulations of the Transportation Department" booklet.

aspect.title: Rule 283
aspect.name: Block signal green for diverging route

aspect.title: Rule 284
aspect.name: Block signal yellow over green
aspect.indication: Reduce to medium speed and proceed. Next signal indicates "Proceed on diverging route"

aspect.title: Rule 285
aspect.name: Approach signal yellow
aspect.indication: Proceed not exceeding medium speed, prepared to stop short of next home signal.

aspect.title: Rule 285-A
aspect.name: Approach medium - flashing yellow
aspect.indication: Proceed prepared to pass next signal at not exceeding medium speed.

aspect.title: Rule 286
aspect.name: Distant signal yellow
aspect.indication: Proceed not exceeding medium speed, prepared to stop short of next home signal.

aspect.title: Rule 287
aspect.name: Grade signal red
aspect.indication: Reduce to restricted speed and proceed.

aspect.title: Rule 288
aspect.name: Home signal yellow for diverging route
aspect.indication: Proceed on diverging route at restricted speed.

aspect.title: Rule 289
aspect.name: Home signal red over lunar
aspect.indication: Proceed without stopping at restricted speed on other than main track.

aspect.title: Rule 291
aspect.name: Flashing yellow
aspect.indication: Stop. Then proceed at restricted speed without calling dispatcher or signal operator.

aspect.title: Rule 292
aspect.name: Flashing white
aspect.indication: Stop. When flashing white displayed be governed by special instructions.

aspect.title: Rule 293
aspect.name: Home signal red, with triangular plate
aspect.indication: Stop. Inspect train, track or structure as provided in special instrutions, and proceed through remainder of block in accordance with provisions of Rule 507, 509, 510, 663, 744, or 776, as the case may be.
